page.title: 05LOCAL DIALECT IN CHERINGTON
page.content: Primary school children living in the South Cotswolds were asked to search for words which they thought might be in local useage. The following have been chosen from their collections:{ {KNOBBY}the end slice of a loaf, {CHUCKY-PIGS}woodlice,{PIKELET}crumpet, {SCRUMPS}batter-scraps,{EMMETT}ant,{ {TUMP}small hill,{PITCH}steep,narrow hill-path,{WEAKERS}ears,{WIVVEL} woodworm,{DIPPIES AND HILLIES}shallow depressions caused in the surface by quarrying,{TATER}potato,{CLOD-HOPPERS} boots or heavy shoes,{CUPPY DOWN} crouch down on ones heels,{DAPS} plimsolls or P.E. shoes,{GURT BIG}very large. Th phrases include:{BIG AS {HAMPTON COMMON, AS SLOW AS BRIMSCOMBE {CLOCK, RUSHING ABOUT LIKE A HEADLESS {CHICKEN,}unnecessary panic. Misuse of grammar:{'ER GIVE I}she gave me,{GI'US {SUMMIT}give me something.
